story.iWant: to view a personalized dashboard with key metrics, progress visualizations, and a weekly review summary
story.soThat: I can monitor my performance and understand my progress over time.
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Implement Dashboard UI Shell & Navigation (AC: 1, 8)** - [ ] **Task 2: Implement Key Metrics Display (AC: 2, 3, 4, 8)** - [ ] **Task 3: Implement Weekly Review Section (AC: 5, 6)** - [ ] **Task 4: Implement Backend `GET /dashboard` API Endpoint (AC: 7, 8)** - [ ] **Task 5: E2E Testing**

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: AC2.5.1: The Dashboard UI is accessible to authenticated users.
AC2.5.2: The Dashboard displays key metrics such as total workout volume (e.g., total weight lifted, total reps), calculated from WorkoutLogs data.
AC2.5.3: The Dashboard displays workout streaks (e.g., consecutive days/weeks of training), calculated from WorkoutLogs data.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Frontend (Next.js `web` app): Responsible for all user-facing features. Handles: Onboarding, Workout Player UI, Dashboard, Settings, User Profile UI, Context Window.

doc.title: UX Design Direction
doc.snippet: The UI for the Dashboard should be based on Flow 14, Screen 1 - screen_1/code.html and the Weekly Review on Flow 14, Screen 2 - screen_2/code.html from ux_design_content.

constraints.constraint: Dashboard data fetching should be optimized to load quickly, especially if dealing with large amounts of historical WorkoutLogs data.
Displayed dashboard data accurately reflects WorkoutLogs data within a tolerance of Â±1%.

tests.standards: Jest/React Testing Library for frontend UI, Pytest for backend API and service logic, Playwright for E2E tests covering dashboard display.

ideas.idea: Unit test dashboard components for correct display of metrics and visualizations.
E2E test user navigation to the dashboard and verification of data accuracy.
